KPIs.title: Block Production
KPIs.description: In order to have a reliable network, a KPI focusing on block production and validator stability is required. Timestamp of each block can be found using the block explorer (divided by 1000).
KPIs.annihilation: Block finalization lags more than 600 blocks behind head at any point throughout the Measurement period
successEvents: The difference between timestamps of block <n> and block <n+100382> must be less than 604,710,000 milliseconds

KPIs.title: Proposal Clearance
KPIs.description: For the governance process to work, all proposals must be dealt with professionally, and in reasonable time frame to avoiding blocking new proposals coming in.
successEvents: No proposals expire due to missing votes
At no point will the number of active proposal stay at 5 for longer than 14,400 blocks (~24h)
For each new proposal, a forum post is opened for discussion between the Council and other interested parties
KPIs.annihilation: No malicious or unreasonable proposals are approved.

KPIs.title: Content Creation
KPIs.description: To improve the current state of available videos, we will incentivize it.
successEvents: At least 50 new *curated* videos added to the media page
An instructional video that guides a new user through all the steps for uploading and editing a video on the platform
KPIs.annihilation: A video not in line with the platform ToS remains available for more than 24h.

KPIs.title: State of the Network Reporting
KPIs.description: There needs to be some level of accountability and transparency for the Council. Weekly reports would help the users make informed votes.
successEvents: The Council produces a report on the state of the network tokenomics, and its accounts.
The Council produces a report on the its own performance.
